alert.note: Alert for Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 1:48AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Scotts Bluff and northern Morrill Counties through 145 AM MDT... At 1247 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Moomaws Corner, or 15 miles east of Scottsbluff, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Moomaws Corner, Angora and The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
